title: Remove absolutized words and rephrase
original_prompt: I want you to act as Check and correct any absolute terms in the text I provided.
input1: "Everyone knows that this is the best solution available, and nobody ever disagrees with it. It is always effective in every situation without fail."
input2: "All students find math to be the most difficult subject, and no one has ever succeeded without extra help. It is impossible to understand without a tutor."
input1_ans:
Here’s a revised version of your text with the absolute terms corrected:

"Many people believe that this is one of the best solutions available, and some may disagree with it. It is often effective in a variety of situations."

The statement contains absolute terms such as "everyone," "nobody," "always," and "every." These terms imply that there are no exceptions, which can be problematic in arguments or discussions. 

Here’s a corrected version that avoids absolute terms:

"Many people believe that this is one of the best solutions available, and while some may disagree, it has proven effective in a variety of situations."
input2_ans:
The text contains several absolute terms that can be corrected for a more balanced perspective. Here’s a revised version:

"Many students find math to be a challenging subject, and some may benefit from extra help. It can be difficult to understand without a tutor, but some students are able to grasp the concepts on their own."

The statement contains absolute terms that may not accurately reflect the experiences of all students. Here’s a corrected version that avoids absolutes:

"Many students find math to be a challenging subject, and some may benefit from extra help. While some students may struggle to understand the material without a tutor, others may succeed through self-study or different resources."
